column1: Art Institute of Chicago////We wanted to see Van Gogh's Bedroom exhibit and it did not disappoint. I wish they had done some crowd control as it was very very crowded
column2: but they nailed the exhibit! Getting to stand in the replica of the house where he lived with Gauguin gave me chills. I know it's not the same as the actual house
column3: but the depiction showed how primitive the space was and what close proximity two of my favorite artists lived in. I loved seeing the variances between his bedroom paintings too. Seeing the other Van Gogh's was just the icing on the cake for that exhibit.
